text: Lee Ford Tannehill (October 26, 1880 – February 16, 1938) was a professional baseball player. He played all or part of ten seasons in Major League Baseball, from 1903 until 1912, for the Chicago White Sox, primarily as a third baseman and shortstop. He was the brother of pitcher Jesse Tannehill. He also was the first player to hit a home run in Comiskey Park.Lee Tannehill at Baseball Library ==See also== *List of Major League Baseball players who spent their entire career with one franchise == Notes == == External links == * Category:Major League Baseball third basemen Category:Major League Baseball shortstops Category:Chicago White Sox players Category:Richmond Blue Birds players Category:Colorado Springs Millionaires players Category:Minneapolis Millers (baseball) players Category:Louisville Colonels (minor league) players Category:Kansas City Blues (baseball) players Category:Omaha Rourkes players Category:South Bend Benders players Category:Grand Rapids Black Sox players Category:Jacksonville Roses players Category:Dallas Giants players Category:Minor league baseball managers Category:Baseball players from Kentucky Category:1880 births Category:1938 deaths
title: Lee Tannehill
